item.title: I just found a quick way to make an array!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“Janilabo, post:5, topic:18419”]Lol, ok, sorry Ron :o

I don’t think he made fun of you… He said it to me. ;D Nice code Ron. I still have long way to go to be as good as you (but I am getting there! …someday :D)… You learn things amazingly fast![/quote]
Yeah but I wouldn’t be able to do it without your support. Thank you.

You’ll get there. It’s just code. Think of it as telling a child exactly what to do, look for easier ways to do things, and never release code with bugs in it. The 3 rules to coding.

item.title: I just found a quick way to make an array!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Janilabo, that doesn’t make an array. Cause if you add, WriteLn(MyArray[1]) in your script, it won’t work.

When I did the writeln’s in my script, I was just trying to show that the script actually did that. It did create an array lol.

program QuickWayToMakeAnArrayEditedABit;

var
  i: Integer;

const
  ArrayName = 'MyArray';
  TextForArray = 'value';
  HowMany = 4;

begin
  ClearDebug;
  WriteLn('A pretty quick way to make an array!');
  for i := 0 to HowMany - 1 do
  begin
    WriteLn('  '+ArrayName+'['+IntToStr(i)+']'+' := '''+TextForArray+' '+IntToStr(i+1)+''';');
  end;
  WriteLn(MyArray[1]);
end.
frank_:

noob

Don’t make fun of me! lol.

Read full topic
item.source: I just found a quick way to make an array!

item.title: I just found a quick way to make an array!
item.dc:creator: @Janilabo Janilabo
item.description:
@Janilabo wrote:

Great one, Ron. I like it alot! Makes life easier. ;D

Also, I made an edited version of that… It’s just a bit(yes, only a bit) more flexible.

[code]program QuickWayToMakeAnArrayEditedABit;

var
i: Integer;

const
ArrayName = ‘MyArray’;
TextForArray = ‘value’;
HowMany = 4;

begin
ClearDebug;
WriteLn(‘A pretty quick way to make an array!’);
for i := 0 to HowMany - 1 do
begin
WriteLn(’ ‘+ArrayName+’[’+IntToStr(i)+’]’+’ := ‘’’+TextForArray+’ ‘+IntToStr(i+1)+’’’;’);
end;
end.[/code]

Basically, at the moment, it does same job than yours code. Except, well, maybe try yourself. pssst. …You can choose how many arrays the script creates for you, the names also can be choosed…

Read full topic
item.source: I just found a quick way to make an array!

item.title: I just found a quick way to make an array!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Did anyone know you could make an array in scar using this?

MyArray := [‘value 1’, ‘value 2’, ‘value 3’, ‘value 4’];

Program QuickWayToMakeAnArray;

Var
  MyArray : Array of String;
  i : Integer;

Begin
  ClearDebug;
  MyArray := ['value 1', 'value 2', 'value 3', 'value 4'];
  WriteLn('A very quick way to make an array!');
  For i := 0 to GetArrayLength(MyArray)-1 do
  Begin
    WriteLn('  MyArray['+IntToStr(i)+'] := '''+MyArray[i]+''';');
  End;
End.

~Ron

Read full topic
item.source: I just found a quick way to make an array!
